original: Exhibit 10.6 TRADEMARK LICENSE AGREEMENT This TRADEMARK LICENSE AGREEMENT (this “ Agreement ”) is made and effective as of [ ] day of [ ], 2020 (“ Effective Date ”), by and between Palmer Square Capital Management LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (the “ Licensor ”), and Palmer Square Capital BDC Inc., a corporation organized under the laws of the State of Maryland (the “ Licensee ”) (each a “ party ,” and collectively, the “ parties ”).

Exhibit 10.6 TRADEMARK USAGE AUTHORIZATION AGREEMENT

This TRADEMARK USAGE AUTHORIZATION AGREEMENT (hereinafter referred to as the "Agreement") is executed on [ ] day of [ ], 2020 ("Effective Date"), by and among Palmer Square Capital Management LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (hereinafter referred to as the "Authorizer"), and Palmer Square Capital BDC Inc., a corporation organized under the laws of the State of Maryland (hereinafter referred to as the "User") (each a "party", and collectively, the "parties").

In this Agreement, it is understood that the User shall be granted limited authorization to use certain trademarks belonging to the Authorizer, subject to specific conditions. The Authorizer retains all rights, title, and interest in and to such trademarks, and the User's authorization is non-exclusive and non-transferable. This Agreement does not grant the User any ownership or control over these trademarks, but rather allows for their limited use under this Agreement only. Any misuse or violation of the terms of this Agreement by the User shall result in immediate termination of the authorization and potential legal action by the Authorizer.

original: 2.2. Compliance With Laws . Licensee agrees that the business operated by it in connection with the Licensed Mark shall comply with all laws, rules, regulations and requirements of any governmental body in the Territory or elsewhere as may be applicable to the operation, marketing, and promotion of the business and shall notify Licensor of any action that must be taken by Licensee to comply with such law, rules, regulations or requirements.
ollama_generated: 2.2. Adherence to Regulatory Requirements . Licensee acknowledges its duty to ensure that the activities conducted under the Licensed Mark within the Territory, or elsewhere as applicable, adhere to all relevant laws, statutes, ordinances, and guidelines imposed by governing bodies, related to the operation, advertisement, and promotion of the business. The Licensee will keep the Licensor informed about any necessary actions that must be taken in response to such legal requirements, while the Licensor shall not be held responsible for ensuring or maintaining compliance with these laws.

original: 2.3. Notification of Infringement . Each party shall immediately notify the other party and provide to the other party all relevant background facts upon becoming aware of (a) any registrations of, or applications for registration of, marks in the Territory that do or may conflict with the Licensor’s rights in the Licensed Mark or the rights granted to the Licensee under this Agreement, (b) any infringements or misuse of the Licensed Mark in the Territory by any third party (“ Third Party Infringement ”), or (c) any claim that Licensee’s use of the Licensed Mark infringes the intellectual property rights of any third party in the Territory (“ Third Party Claim ”). Licensor shall have the exclusive right, but not the obligation, to prosecute, defend and/or settle in its sole discretion, all actions, proceedings and claims involving any Third Party Infringement or Third Party Claim, and to take any other action that it deems necessary or proper for the protection and preservation of its rights in the Licensed Mark.
ollama_generated: 2.3. Notification of Potential Conflicts and Infringements: Each party shall promptly inform the other party about any circumstances they become aware of, including (a) registrations or applications for registration of marks within the Territory that may potentially conflict with the Licensor's rights in the Licensed Mark or rights conferred upon the Licensee under this Agreement, (b) any suspected or confirmed instances of unauthorized use or misrepresentation of the Licensed Mark within the Territory by any third party (hereafter referred to as "Possible Third-Party Infringement"), or (c) any claims made by a third party asserting that the Licensee's use of the Licensed Mark infringes upon their intellectual property rights within the Territory ("Third-Party Claim"). The Licensor shall retain the right, but not the obligation, to investigate, defend, negotiate resolutions, and take legal action in its sole discretion, against any Possible Third-Party Infringement or Third-Party Claim, and to undertake any other actions it deems necessary for safeguarding and preserving its rights to the Licensed Mark. This does not relieve the Licensee of their obligation to cease using the Licensed Mark if such use is found to infringe upon a third party's intellectual property rights within the Territory, nor transfer any liability or responsibility from the Licensor to the Licensee in relation to any Third-Party Infringement or Third-Party Claim.

original: (c) No Conflict.  Such party’s execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement do not: (i) violate, conflict with or result in the breach of any provision of the operating agreement, charter or bylaws (or similar organizational documents) of such party; (ii) conflict with or violate any governmental order applicable to such party or any of its assets, properties or businesses; or (iii) conflict with, result in any breach of, constitute a default (or event which with the giving of notice or lapse of time, or both, would become a default) under, require any consent under, or give to others any rights of termination, amendment, acceleration, suspension, revocation or cancellation of any contract, agreement, lease, sublease, license, permit, franchise or other instrument or arrangement to which it is a party.
ollama_generated: (c) Potential Conflicts Mitigated. Execution, delivery, and performance of this Agreement by either party will not: (i) infringe upon, contravene, or lead to a breach of any provision within the operating agreement, charter, bylaws (or equivalent organizational documents) of the other party; (ii) violate or run counter to any legally binding order pertaining to the executing party, its assets, properties, or operations; nor (iii) jeopardize compliance with, trigger a default (or an impending default with notice or passage of time), necessitate consent under, grant others the power of termination, amendment, acceleration, suspension, revocation, or cancellation of any contract, agreement, lease, sublease, license, permit, franchise, or other binding commitment held by either party, except where such actions have been explicitly pre-approved in writing.

original: 5.2. Assignment . Licensee shall not sublicense, assign, pledge, grant or otherwise encumber or transfer to any third party all or any part of its rights or duties under this Agreement, in whole or in part, without the prior written consent of the Licensor, which consent Licensor may grant or withhold in its sole and absolute discretion. Any purported transfer without such consent shall be void ab initio .
ollama_generated: 5.2. Transfer of Rights and Obligations: The Licensor retains the unconditional right, at any time and in its sole discretion, to assign, pledge, grant, or otherwise encumber or transfer all or any part of its rights and obligations under this Agreement, in whole or in part, without requiring the prior written consent of the Licensee. Any such transfer by the Licensor shall immediately bind the Licensee, with no right for the Licensee to contest or reject such transferred rights or obligations. Any attempted transfer of rights or obligations by the Licensee without the express, written consent of the Licensor will be deemed null and void.

original: 5.10. Counterparts . This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which when executed shall be deemed to be an original instrument and all of which taken together shall constitute one and the same agreement. Facsimile or portable document format (PDF) counterpart signatures to this Agreement shall be acceptable and binding.
ollama_generated: 5.10. Multiple Executions: It is permissible for this Agreement to be signed in multiple copies, each of which, upon execution, will be considered an authentic original. Collectively, these copies will comprise a single, unified agreement. Electronic signatures via facsimile or portable document format (PDF) shall hold the same legal weight and binding force as traditional handwritten signatures.
